items.title: Fresh Insights Where Decay Meets Architecture
items.abstract: Thom Andersen’s film “Reconversão,” coming to the Museum of the Moving Image’s First Look series, examines buildings by the Portuguese architect Eduardo Souto de Moura.

items.title: Ada Louise Huxtable, Champion of Livable Architecture, Dies at 91
items.abstract: Ms. Huxtable pioneered modern architectural criticism in The New York Times, celebrating buildings that respected human dignity and civic history.

items.title: Koolhaas to Curate Next Venice Architecture Biennale
items.abstract: The board of directors of the Venice Biennale on Tuesday appointed the architect Rem Koolhaas to be director of its architecture sector, with responsibility for curating the 14th International Architecture Exhibition in 2014.

items.title: The Motor City Though the Camera Lens
items.abstract: An exhibition at the Detroit Institute of Arts focuses on local landscapes of streets and cars and the automobile culture of Detroit.

items.title: An Urban Standard, Coolly Reimagined
items.abstract: William Lescaze’s 1935 Kramer house, like many Modernist houses, is not weathering well.

items.title: Pritzker Prize for Architecture Is Awarded to Alejandro Aravena of Chile
items.abstract: Mr. Aravena, who has focused on low-cost social housing and reconstructing after natural disasters, received the honor as Chile emerges as a locus of noteworthy architecture.

items.title: Josef Frank: Celebrating the Anti-Design Designer
items.abstract: The Austrian Museum of Applied Arts/Contemporary Art has mounted the biggest exhibition of the designer's work in 30 years, hoping to burnish his reputation.
keywords: Austrian Museum of Applied Arts / Contemporary Art (Vienna, Austria)

items.title: How to Build Affordable Housing in New York City
items.abstract: Recent projects in which public housing was renovated by private developers could show a path forward.

items.title: National World War I Memorial Proposal Is Unveiled
items.abstract: A plan for a privately funded war memorial would create a raised lawn with a sculpture on a 1.8 acre site near the White House, not part of the National Mall.

items.title: Hieronymus Bosch Is Credited With Work in Kansas City Museum
items.abstract: A 16th-century depiction of St. Anthony that had been attributed to the workshop of Bosch or a follower is now thought to be by the Dutch master’s hand.

items.title: Mexico City as the Director of ‘Roma’ Remembers It (and Hears It)
items.abstract: Alfonso Cuarón revisits the sights and sounds of the neighborhood that inspired his critically acclaimed film.

items.title: An Indian City Bursting With Action
items.abstract: The present-day version of Chennai in South India dates back to only the 1600s, so a relatively youthful exuberance should not come as a surprise.

items.title: As If by Design, Their Connection Was Inevitable
items.abstract: William Ackman had been given two nudges by two friends to reach out to Neri Oxman. He found they were both right.

items.title: Nathan Glazer, Urban Sociologist and Outspoken Intellectual, Dies at 95
items.abstract: Mr. Glazer often waded into heated debates over contentious issues about race, ethnicity, immigration and education.

items.title: A Guide to Antigua, Guatemala: A Candy-Colored City Framed by Volcanoes
items.abstract: With its Baroque architecture and thriving textile scene, this former colonial capital is among Central America’s most beguiling destinations.

items.title: Mexico City’s Newfound Status: A Skateboarder’s Paradise
items.abstract: With improved accessibility and support from the government, skateboarding schools, stores and a diverse social scene have taken flight.

items.title: A Mayor and the Challenge of Making the City Safer
items.abstract: Eric Adams made public safety a campaign issue. Now, as mayor, he will be held accountable.

items.title: After Urban Flight, Corporate Campuses Add a Taste of the City
items.abstract: Suburban headquarters are being redesigned to add more amenities that will integrate better with their communities and attract the skilled workers.

items.title: Cooper Hewitt Design Museum Gets a New Director
items.abstract: Maria Nicanor, an architecture curator and historian, takes on the Smithsonian position held by Caroline Baumann, who in 2020 was abruptly forced to resign.

items.title: A Design Duo Adding Whimsy to Traditional Woodwork
items.abstract: The East London furniture makers Wilkinson & Rivera are giving classic silhouettes a playful twist.
